list_definition.definition: to make the forehead wrinkle and the eyebrows move down (as a sign of worry, disapproval, deep thought etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He frowned at her bad behaviour.

list_definition.definition: such a movement of the forehead and eyebrows

list_ex_of_english: Unethical practices on the part of private and public sectors while frowned upon were not openly criticised.
The immorality of instrumental ethnicity was frowned upon as tending to exacerbate social instability.
Also, puzzled facial expressions, frowns and various types of mime and gestures.
Pace and mood may be set with smiles, jokes, frowns, exclamations, and volume, rapidity, or intonation of speech.
I used localist representations, as they were not frowned upon at that time.
Remarriage by divorced or widowed women was not frowned upon.
The professor frowned at the technician of the physician who always seemed to be unhappy.
It would be hard going for the novice (it certainly had me frowning in some of the geochemical sections).
